content.description: SDS matched low on the sloping arête. Work up the sloping feature to a crux dead point before heading up big ledges and toping out. The ramp on the left side of the overhang is off.
content.location: The obvious prow feature left of Dream Eater.

content.description: Sit-start with both hands low on the sloping arête. Climb into the double-wide refrigerator feature and utilize heel and toe hooks to ease the strain of compressing through the severe overhang. Gain large edges at the start of the gently overhung head wall before executing a heartbreaking stab off sloping features just beneath the top out. Sustained, powerful and gymnastic movement on an inspiring formation of rock.Detached blocks are off.
content.location: Climbs the prominent prow left of Dream Eater

content.description: SDS compressing the overhanging fridge feature, squeeze your way up before trending left and topping out. A powerful and sequential moderate. Classic.
content.location: Center face of the east half of the dream.

content.description: Stand start, compressing the double arête feature with feet on the ramp below. Climb up the tall blocky face on great features. Highball.
content.location: The tall face left of the big prow.

content.description: The high start to Mr. Sandman. Stand start with a right foot toe-hook, left hand on a large edge near the lip of the overhang and, right hand on a sloping edge in the overhang. Tension into a sharp edge before working up the face to a crux stab beneath the lip. Top out.
content.location: Prominent Prow left of Dream Eater

content.description: SDS matched in a horizontal crack in back of the roof. Follow the crack up and left through the overhang. Top out above.
content.location: Right side on the swamp facing section of the dream.

content.description: Start crouched on edges, climb the slab and top out. An aesthetic line.
content.location: Left side on the east face of The Dream

content.description: SDS, climb the thin crack and top out.
SDS back in the overhang matched on a horizontal crack. Climb out right through crimps before making a crux move to a ledge before climbing the face and topping out.
content.location: Right side on swamp-side face of the dream.

content.description: A large rectangular feature that extends out of a hill into the swamp. The Dream contains many unique blocky and extruded features. We ran out of time, but there’s more hard climbing to come from this area in the fall.
